DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification of the status of immune dysregulation post bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immune Dysregulation Timepoint Post Transplantation Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR Primary Immunosuppression CRF template.10.21.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.value: Active issues with no further intervention
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Active Immune Dysregulation Issues Without Intervention

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Active Immune Dysregulation Issues Without Intervention
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Active Immune Dysregulation Issues Despite Intervention

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Active Immune Dysregulation Issues Despite Intervention
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

Concepts.definition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
